name: tau Boo
scenarioDescription:
The tau Boo Exoplanetary System


Overview

tau Boo is a star with 1.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.46 times its radius. It is located 51.08 light years away from the solar system.

tau Boo is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the tau Boo system


tau Boo b

tau Boo b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of tau Boo b is 1373.76 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, tau Boo b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system tau Boo, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
